ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: Has a medical or educational professional (e.g., a doctor, psychologist, psychiatrist, nurse practitioner, developmental pediatrician, licensed clinical social worker, or licensed therapist) diagnosed (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) with an autism spectrum condition? Autism spectrum conditions include autism spectrum disorder, autistic disorder, Asperger's disorder, and pervasive developmental disability - not otherwise specified.
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= No, but (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) identify as autistic, on the autism spectrum, or as a person with autism; 3= I do not know

ElementDescription: How old were (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) when (you/they) were first diagnosed?
Notes: 1= Younger than 5; 2= 5 - 10; 3= 10 - 17; 4= 18 - 24; 5= 25 - 30; 6= 31 - 40; 7= 41 or older; 8= I am not sure, but it was as a child (less than 18 years of age); 9= I am not sure, but it was as an adult (18 years of age or older); 10= I do not know

ElementDescription: Has a medical or educational professional diagnosed (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) or attention deficit disorder (ADD)?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= No, but I am pretty sure that (Direct Report: I / Caregiver Report: they) have ADHD or ADD; 3= I do not know

ElementDescription: Are (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) deaf or do (you/they) have serious difficulty hearing?
Are (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) blind or do (you/they) have serious difficulty seeing, even when wearing glasses?
Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) have serious difficulty walking or climbing stairs?
Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) have an intellectual disability (ID)?
Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) have a different learning disability, such as dyslexia?

How often do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) need support to do any of (your/their) basic self-care activities such as eating, dressing, bathing, going to the bathroom, or brushing (your/their) teeth?
Notes: 1= Always or often; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or never

ElementDescription: How often do (Direct Report: you get / Caregiver Report: you think they get) the support (you/they) need to do (your/their) basic self-care activities? (e.g., eating, dressing, bathing, going to the bathroom, or brushing your/their teeth)
Notes: 1= Always or often; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or never

ElementDescription: How often do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) need support to do activities such as cooking, cleaning, shopping, managing money, getting around in the community, or keeping appointments?
Notes: 1= Always or often; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or never

ElementDescription: How often do (Direct Report: you get / Caregiver Report: you think they get) the support (you/they) need to do activities such as cooking, shopping, managing money, getting around in the community, or keeping appointments?
Notes: 1= Always or often; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or never

ElementDescription: Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) currently get ANY type of social security (such as SSI, SSDI, survivor benefits etc.)?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= I do not know

ElementDescription: Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) currently get developmental disability services? These are for people with developmental disabilities including autism, intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, and other related conditions. They usually give (you/them) a case manager, a personal agent (PA), or service coordinator. Examples of things DD services could give (you/them) or pay for might include case management/having a case manager, program planning to develop an Individual Program Plan, evaluations, help getting connected to other services, work programs, transportation, residential services, nursing/home aid services, behavioral intervention, respite)
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= I do not know

ElementDescription: Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) currently get vocational rehabilitation or other employment support services?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= I do not know

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help

(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.

(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Dichotomous Childhood/Adulthood Age of Autism Formal Diagnosis Variable
Notes: 1= Diagnosed as a child (less than 18 years); 2= Diagnosed as an adult (greater than 17 years); calculated from disch_diagnosis_age.
